Entries.Mon2: Hi. Have you seen anything interesting on your walks around town yet?
Entries.Mon4: A lot of technical work must go into designing and running a farm. What do you do to clear your mind when you get a bit flustered?
Entries.Mon6: Sometimes my head gets so cluttered with nonsense I can hardly think. Does that ever happen to you?#$e#Getting some fresh air usually helps.
Entries.Mon8: Isn't it funny how the solution to a tough problem can just appear in your head as soon as you stop thinking about it?
Entries.Mon10: These days, I take walks just because I hope I'll run into you.$l#$e#Looks like today's my lucky day!$h#$e#How about tomorrow, too?
Entries.Tue2: Stop by our house when you need to upgrade your buildings.#$e#It's always nice to have visitors.
Entries.Tue4: Hmm... I wonder if there's anything I could craft that would make my mom's job easier...#$e#With the way she works, you'd think she was twenty years younger.$h
Entries.Tue6: I worry about my mom when she works in the rain. What if she got struck by lightning?$s#$e#Do you have some lightning rods on your farm?
Entries.Tue8: My mom's always been really supportive of me in my pursuits. So has my dad.#$e#I don't think I would've done as well if I'd had anyone else as parents.
Entries.Tue10: It's important to sit back and enjoy the finer things in life.#$e#Sometimes, my brain starts going a mile a minute and it gets overwhelming.#$b#But thankfully, I've managed to settle down now.
Entries.Tue6_inlaw_Penny: Penny used to talk about you all the time.#$b#Eventually, I was like, "Hey! You'd better ask that boy out if he doesn't ask you out first!"$h^Eventually, I was like, "Hey! You'd better ask that girl out if she doesn't ask you out first!"$h
Entries.Wed2: Days at the clinic are nice when I get to learn something new.#$e#If I don't learn something new every day, the day just ends up feeling incomplete.
Entries.Wed4: Dr. Harvey was about to throw out his defibrillator, but I opened it and fixed it up no problem.#$e#Unfortunately, he still had to replace it. Something about protocol and avoiding lawsuits...$s
Entries.Wed6: The heart monitor in the clinic's treatment room could really use a few improvements.#$b#It wouldn't be too hard to install a voice command system on it. That's just one thing.#$e#It's just wishful thinking, though. I know I can't tamper with standardized medical equipment.$s
Entries.Wed8: I work at Harvey's clinic on Tuesdays and Thursdays.#$e#He's nice, but not really my type...
Entries.Thu4: Looks like it'll be another slow day at the clinic.#$e#There's only so much I'm licensed to do, anyway.
Entries.Thu6: I plan on spending a lot of time with my telescope this summer.#$e#You should join me on an evening when the weather's clear.$h
Entries.Thu10: Oh, @! Is there anything you want to talk to me about?$h#$e#I was just thinking about you.
Entries.Fri: Hey, sorry if I seem cranky... I'm a little sore from work yesterday.#$c .5# I had to carry ten boxes of medical files to the attic!#$e#I had to sort patient records for four hours straight!
Entries.Fri2: Penny's a great friend. We've gotten along ever since my family moved here.#$e#Be sure to say hi, okay?
Entries.Fri4: My mother is a carpenter and my dad is a scientist. I guess it makes sense that I'm into building gadgets.
Entries.Fri6: Ooh, what a week. I didn't make as much progress on my projects as I'd hoped.$s#$e#Did your week go well, though?
Entries.Fri8: What do you think farming will look like, a hundred years from now?#$e#I guess there's no replacement for the human touch, is there?$l
Entries.Sat: Do you know my dad, Demetrius? He's a scientist. I have a lot of fun helping him out in the laboratory.
Entries.Sat2: My dad's studying the unique properties of the valley. You won't find a lot of ecosystems around the world like this one.
Entries.Sat4: I haven't quite decided what kind of science I want to pursue as a long-term career.#$e#Maybe I'll just keep doing a little bit of everything.$h#$e#Though, it would be nice to have some kind of contribution to the world.
Entries.Sat6: Rocket propulsion was an early interest of mine. I still dabble in it, from time to time.
Entries.Sat8: I want to save up so I can order some iridium from a hardware catalog. The stuff is crazy-expensive, though.$s#$e#But... oh, the things I could do with it!$l
Entries.Sat10: Everyone needs a happy place to retreat to and be alone. The bench by the community center is mine.#$e#There's the other bench by the saloon, but that's where I meet up with Penny.#$e#Though, I wouldn't mind it if you joined me at the happy bench.$l
Entries.Sun8: You must enjoy your work quite a bit if you've stuck around town this long.#$e#I'm really happy for you.$h
Entries.Sun10: You must enjoy your work quite a bit if you've stuck around town this long.#$e#I do, too. We make a good pair, don't we?$l
Entries.summer_Mon: Hmm... What sort of gadget should I tinker with this summer?
Entries.summer_Mon2: I've got a lot on my summer to-do list with my gadget projects. I hope I can get through it all!
Entries.summer_Mon6: When you're working on an experimental tech project, there are a dozen failures for every success.#$e#The way things don't work can be just as exciting as the way they do work.#$b#...As long as no one gets hurt.$s
Entries.summer_Mon10: Whenever I'm working on a project these days, I'm always keeping you in mind as I work.#$e#You're somewhat of a muse, I guess. I just want to see your reactions to things.$l
Entries.summer_Tue2: My brother only tends to come out of his room in the afternoon.#$e#Sometimes we go for a couple of days before our paths cross.$s
Entries.summer_Tue4_inlaw_Sebastian: Heyyy, brother-in-law!$h^Heyyy, sister-in-law!$h#$e#Sebastian seems so much happier now that he doesn't have to live here. I hope things are well!
Entries.summer_Wed2: Ick, it's incredibly hot. I bet Sebastian's room is really cool right now by comparison.#$e#I wouldn't know for sure, though. I rarely actually go down there.
Entries.summer_Wed4: Is it just me or did it suddenly get really hot?#$e#I guess it's just me.
Entries.summer_Wed6: Tonight's a good night to do some stargazing. You should stop by.
Entries.summer_Wed8: I wonder if I can find some celestial bodies I haven't seen before tonight?
Entries.summer_Wed10: It's strange. Looking at the cosmos through my telescope seems a little lonely these days.$s#$e#Just lonely... without you with me.
Entries.summer_Thu10: How do your hands stay so soft with all that farm work?
Entries.summer_Fri4: Dad and I sometimes go out for ice cream. Sebastian used to come too, but he doesn't anymore.
Entries.summer_Fri6: I'm glad I get to work at such a slow clinic. If we lived somewhere else, it'd take up so much more of my time.#$e#The hours I work each week are perfect for me.
Entries.summer_Fri10: Hey @. We should hang out sometime by the lake and share some ice cream.#$e#Do you like that idea?
Entries.summer_Sat: Hey, have any interesting farm stories to tell me?#$e#Guess not.
Entries.summer_Sat2: Trying to build something mechanical is a game of problem solving. I enjoy having to think outside the box.#$e#Is anything in your job like that, too?
Entries.summer_Sat4: Hmm... I wonder if robots will ever be popular enough to replace animals as pets?#$e#Well, probably not during our lifetimes.
Entries.summer_Sat6: My parents support my work, but they draw the line at bringing a nuclear reactor into the house.#$e#What? I could handle it.$h#$b#In theory, anyway. They're not that dangerous if you know what you're doing.
Entries.summer_Sat10: It's in the middle of summer like this when I see you, @, and my whole heart just feels warm.$l#$e#In the evenings, especially, I just get the sense that later in life, I'll be nostalgic for these days.
Entries.summer_Sun: I bet you're growing some interesting crops right now.#$b#Dad says a lot of exotic plants grow in the valley this time of year.
Entries.summer_Sun4: I can keep myself pretty disciplined. It helps to stick to a schedule.#$e#How about you?
Entries.summer_Sun8: I wonder if I should apply for a job as a researcher in a university.#$e#I'd miss the valley, though. And I can do pretty much everything I want to out here, though, so...
Entries.summer_Sun10: I wonder if I should apply for a job as a researcher in a university.#$e#I'd miss the valley, though. And I can do pretty much everything I want to out here, though, so...#$e#And there's you.$l
Entries.fall_Mon4: Remember how margarine used to be more popular than butter, because it was supposedly healthier?#$e#Then they found out margarine is actually even worse for you than butter. So now we're back to butter.#$e#Research is a funny journey, sometimes.$h
Entries.fall_Mon6: Hmm, the air smells nice. Today's a good day to be outside.
Entries.fall_Mon8: You should come visit me at the clinic tomorrow. I work from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.$h
Entries.fall_Mon_inlaw_Sebastian: Oh, hey @! How's my brother doing?
Entries.fall_Tue2: The colors of this season are what really make me love it so much.#$e#We all have a good excuse to go outside.
Entries.fall_Tue4: @, I just love how the trees look right now!#$e#I know you like them too.
Entries.fall_Tue8: Days like these remind me of when I first went to school as a little girl.#$e#Any nostalgic memories for you, @?
Entries.fall_Tue10: Rocket propulsion, arm robotics, artificial intelligence... the synthesis of these elements is something really special.#$e#There's still a long way to go in each science. Endless possibilities, really.
Entries.fall_Wed4: If you have any extra metal lying around, I could always use it for one of my projects.#$e#But only if you don't need it yourself.
Entries.fall_Wed6: You've probably crafted some pretty neat devices of your own. Have you made a mayonnaise machine?#$e#It's actually pretty easy. The properties of the earth crystal do most of the work for you.
Entries.fall_Wed8: Gold is for much more than just decorative purposes. It's also a really good conductor for electrical equipment.#$e#But it's not like anybody just has some of it just lying around, right?$h
Entries.fall_Wed10: Mmm, this is nice. Beautiful autumn day, light refreshing breeze...#$b#...boyfriend on my arm...$l^...girlfriend on my arm...$l
Entries.fall_Thu: In other parts of the world it's spring right now. Imagine that!
Entries.fall_Thu4: It sure would be interesting to see artificial intelligence interact with organic intelligence.#$e#It'd be even more interesting if we could meld the two in one lifeform. Got any cows who'd be up for a 'bionic cow' experiment?$h#$e#Ha, just kidding.
Entries.fall_Thu8: Ever heard of a crystalarium? They seem a bit tricky to make, but not impossible.#$e#I would make one if I had the materials.
Entries.fall_Fri4: Dr. Harvey seems to be in good spirits lately. It was a good week at the clinic this week.
Entries.fall_Fri6: I've been feeling especially optimistic lately...$h
Entries.fall_Fri8: Artificial intelligence is really fascinating. I'm not quite as good at programming as Sebastian is...#$b#...but there are some preset AI modules that I've tried altering myself.#$e#Even some basic emotion algorithms should be possible, but of course I keep it relatively rudimentary.
Entries.fall_Fri10: Mmm, this weather's making me crave sweets.#$e#...And you. *giggle*$l
Entries.fall_Sat4: The way all the organisms in the wild perish and survive to sustain one ecosystem...#$b#...there's a lot we can learn and apply to making any complex system stable.
Entries.fall_Sat6: My dad had a really cool experiment earlier this week.#$b#The microbes in the lake actually stabilize the lake's pH levels. But in order to do that, the microbes have to die in massive quantities.#$e#Am I bad if it was fun to replicate the process in the lab?$s#$e#Well, you know, nature's both cruel and beautiful.
Entries.fall_Sat10: Ugh, my thoughts are just spinning out of control right now. It's like my brain is in overdrive.$s#$e#Can you rub my back? I've got to breathe slowly. *sigh*#$b# ...One, two, three, four, five, six, seven...$s#$e#One more time...#$e#...$s#$e#Thanks. I'll be okay.$l
Entries.fall_Sun2: Any plans for next week? Or just taking it day by day?
Entries.fall_Sun4: Hey, here's to another good week! *toast*
Entries.fall_Sun6: Ugh, I can't stop my thoughts from spinning like a whirlwind.$s#$e#Sorry.$s
Entries.fall_Sun8: Hey, nice running into you. How was your week?
Entries.fall_Sun10: You have a leaf in your hair. Let me get it for you.#$e#...$h
Entries.winter_Mon2: My snowman looks a tiny bit different each year, but my inner kid pretends it's the same soul who always comes back to visit.
Entries.winter_Mon4: You're never too old to build a snowman.#$b#Anyone who's tired of snowmen is tired of life.$h
Entries.winter_Mon6: I think I'll do a little patch-up work on my snowman today. Maybe I can get him to last until the new year.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: Hi @!$h#$e#Hey, don't you think my snowman looks kind of like you?
Entries.winter_Tue4: Hey, do you have any ideas for a new gadget I can make?#$e#Mhmm. I trust your opinion.
Entries.winter_Tue6: I wonder if I could make a device that could keep my hair from getting frizzy when the weather's dry...
Entries.winter_Tue8: One of my first ideas for an invention was an automatic snowball maker and thrower.#$e#I never actually finished the project, because I had the idea when I was seven.#$b#Still, though, shouldn't be too hard...
Entries.winter_Wed4: Hm. I'm a little bored today. How do you pass the time in the winter?#$e#My current projects just aren't doin' it for me, lately. I need a change of pace.
Entries.winter_Wed6: To tell the truth, I feel like I learn even more from Penny than she learns from me.#$e#The way she understands kids and literature, and art... We're a couple of nerds, but we balance each other out.
Entries.winter_Wed6_inlaw_Penny: I'm so happy you wound up with my best friend. I always had a feeling about you and Penny.$l
Entries.winter_Wed10: The world just looks perfect after a fresh-fallen snow.#$e#@, you're a really good person. I hope you recognize that about yourself.$l
Entries.winter_Thu4: I hope Sebastian's okay. I feel like he barely sees the sun during the winter. It's not healthy.$s
Entries.winter_Thu6: I tried asking Sebastian if I could join them the next time Sam comes over, but he looked really unenthusiastic.$s#$e#I mean, I'd understand if I did something wrong, but honestly, why does he single me out like that?$a
Entries.winter_Thu8: I let Sebastian do his own thing these days. I think he just wants to be left alone.#$e#It sucks. I've tried all these years to be a good sister, but I don't think he'll ever stop pushing me away.$s#$e#Well, not every sibling relationship winds up perfect.$s
Entries.winter_Thu10: @, come closer. I'm cold.#$e#My hands are so dry from the winter air. I'm sorry about that.
Entries.winter_Thu4_inlaw_Sebastian: I did a voicechat with Sebastian this morning. Now that he's moved out, it's a lot easier to get along with him.#$b#Isn't it funny how that works?$h
Entries.winter_Fri4: We treated a patient with the flu yesterday. Ugh. I really hope I don't get it, too.$s#$e#No, I can't tell you who it is. Patient confidentiality.#$b#Just be sure to wash your hands a lot.
Entries.winter_Fri6: You look fresh today. I guess it's that crisp winter air.
Entries.winter_Fri10: Your cheeks are all rosy. *giggle* So cute.$l#$e#Mmm, give me a hug.$l
Entries.winter_Sat4: Mmm, if only I could go into the caves and get some precious metals. The amount of things I could accomplish...!#$e#But... I don't want to make my parents worry themselves sick.
Entries.winter_Sat8: @! I'm glad to see you.#$e#It's been a bit of a rough week, but seeing you makes things a little better.#$e#You're just always a pleasant person to be around. It's nice.
Entries.winter_Sun: I get so sleepy when it's cold...
Entries.winter_Sun2: I want to wrap myself up in a blanket, but then I'd just fall asleep. Hmm.#$e#That'd really mess up my sleep cycle if I took a nap.
Entries.winter_Sun4: I get so sleepy when it's cold...
Entries.winter_Sun6: Time travel is theoretically possible. It would just take more energy than anyone can harness.#$e#We're talking... pretty much all the kinetic and potential energy in the world. In one place.
Entries.winter_Sun10: Time travel is theoretically possible.#$b#But even if I could travel through time, I wouldn't want to change anything.$l
Entries.spring_1_2: A good day to you, sir!^A good day to you, @!#$e#How's your year so far?
Entries.summer_1: This is going to be a great season for stargazing.
Entries.summer_27: You'll be at the beach tomorrow night, right? I hope so!
Entries.fall_15: The Stardew Valley Fair is so much fun. It's one of my favorite days of the year.#$e#You should try some of the games they have.
Entries.winter_7: I love my snowman, but I'm interested to see what other people build tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28: Have a good night tonight. Let's count our lucky stars!
Entries.summer_27_2: You'll be at the beach tomorrow night, right? I hope so!
Entries.fall_15_2: The Stardew Valley Fair is so much fun. It's one of my favorite days of the year.#$e#You should try some of the games they have.
Entries.winter_7_2: I love my snowman, but I'm interested to see what other people build tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28_2: Have a good night tonight. Let's count our lucky stars!

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I bet my brother just went to bed an hour or two ago. What a goof.#I wonder how Penny is doing? Maybe I'll give her a call later today.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#Have you seen my flathead screwdriver with the yellow handle? I'm always misplacing that thing...$s#I was just daydreaming... do you think MARILDA is okay? I hope she finds some place where she truly belongs...
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Hey! I had trouble sleeping last night so I fiddled around in my workshop for a bit. Here, I made this for you. [688 369 338 325 287]#$e#$c .5#I'm happy to contribute where I can.$h#I hope you can find some use for it.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Phew, I thought I slept like a baby, but I'm still tired.#The only thing I dislike about rain is the fact that I can't do any stargazing!
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Some of my electronics are getting a bit dusty. That's something I could work on today... or maybe some reading.#Do I hear a leak in the roof? I'll have to check it out. I know a thing or two about carpentry from watching my mother.
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#I stayed inside because of the weather. Not too exciting, but it was relaxing. I kicked back with the latest 'Schematics Weekly'.#Make sure you don't leave your tools out in the rain! You wouldn't want them to get all rusty.
Entries.patio_Maru: #$c .5#When this one's done, it should be useful for helping me cook food. Y'know, MY way, just for fun.#I'm not sure what this is, yet... but it's fun to turn the old wrench now and then.
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: Hi @. How was your day... soggy?#$e#$c .5#Why don't we do an indoor date night tonight? What're you craving?#This weather gives me gadget ideas... maybe if I funnel the rainwater it could power a mill?
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: Dad's been tracking the weather patterns for the last twenty years.#$e#$c .5#I really hope the climate doesn't change to the point where it negatively affects your farming.$s#It's a little too early to tell, but the results have revealed some abnormal trends.
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#Come here. *kiss* I need some human contact tonight.$l#Can we have spaghetti in bed tonight?
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Look what I made. And I didn't even use an oven! Guess how? [232 234 223 220]$h#I made some dessert! Make sure to brush your teeth before bed, though. [232 234 223 220]$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#I have so many little projects I want to work on today... Maybe I should write down a list, before my brain gets too cluttered.#Hmm? Sorry, sometimes I get so lost in thought that I don't even realize what I'm doing.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Got any ideas for how we could put this to use? I just don't like wasting good equipment. [286 287 205 732]#I found this in my scrap pile. Think you could find a use for it? [286 287 205 732]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#There's something about farm life that gets me up early. I don't know what it is. It just feels right.#Finally, you're up! I was getting so hungry... *rumble*$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#What can we do to make today a little more special? Anything fun you've been meaning to get to?#One of the best things about living on the farm is waking up to a chorus of songbirds.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#I used to wonder where I'd end up after moving out. I never imagined it'd be right down the road. How funny.$h#How do you keep your hands so soft with all that farmwork?
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#One day, we'll look at the stars the same way early man looked at the horizon: distant but surmountable.#Did you see the moon tonight? It always looks spectacular on the horizon.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#There are always little optimizations that can be made on the farm, but perhaps more important is whether the layout's pleasing to you.#I saw a shooting star earlier. I like to pretend it's MARILDA stopping by to check on us.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: I can't decide if I'm craving chocolate cake or ripe strawberries. Or maybe both...?#$e#$c .5#Life's too short not to eat more goodies.$h#Be honest... am I gaining weight?$s
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#You did good work today! You deserve to relax the rest of the evening.#Oh, there you are! I was just hoping you'd come home.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I'm really starting to love this old house. It's so cozy at night. Mom's done a great job improving the place.#I'm really proud of the work you do. You know that, right?
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#Oh good! You found me. I was hoping to share a bit of the morning outside with you.#Ahh... the farm smells great, it reminds me of the mountains near my parents' house.
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#I'm sure if my mom were here, she could tell you a little story about every single piece of wood on this side of the house.#With a little planning, we could automate most of the farm work and just relax!
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#No matter how advanced technology gets, I hope this farm and these woods are here for a really, really long time.#It's going to be clear tonight... I wonder if the %noun constellation will be visible?
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Good morning! Mind if I watch you from here?#Don't worry, I won't mind if you track mud into the house. It's fun to get a little dirty now and then.
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#So, what was it like when you first moved here? It's almost tough to remember when I was just your acquaintance.#I never realized the amount of care and planning necessary to run a farm! It's a lot like working in the laboratory.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I'll ask Penny for some kid advice. I know she works with big kids, but she just has a way with the little ones.#Have you spent any time with %kid1 today? Kids need playtime in order reach their full potential.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#What? No, of course I'm not going to make a parenting robot. You can't find a substitute for the human touch.$h#What do you think... will %kid1 grow up to be a farmer? Or an engineer?
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#My parents are thrilled; they just said they never expected to be grandparents at so young an age. Well, Mom and Dad, surprise!#I have high hopes for our child. I've been reading all the scientific data on the best ways to raise children.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#Good thing we have good healthcare here. Dr. Harvey will see our kids in a heartbeat if we need to.#My own workshop, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. Life is pretty good.
Entries.funLeave_Maru: #$c .5#My parents are probably missing me a bit. That's where I'm headed today.#I think I'll visit my parents today. I haven't seen them in a while.
Entries.funReturn_Maru: #$c .5#Well, it was good to go home today, but now it's even better to come 'home-home.' My heart's really here, now.$l#Mom and Dad are doing just fine. Their routine is still the same, even with me gone. How was your day?
Entries.spring_9: Working in a university would be interesting, but honestly, what would I do there that I don't already do?#$b#Invent? Learn? Experiment? I already do all that.$h
Entries.spring_15: I'll see if I can get one of my robots to do the cleaning for us today.#$b#It's more work to get the robot set up and calibrated than if I just did it myself, but it's also more fun.$h
Entries.spring_16: I wonder if my walk to work is shorter or longer now, compared to where I used to live...?
Entries.spring_26: MARILDA really was a one-off kind of invention for me. I'm not even sure I could reproduce another robot like her... And even if I could, hmm...$s#$b#A big part of me wants her to remain special, one of a kind.
Entries.summer_4: I remember one year, when I was a kid, the strawberries came really late in the season.#$b#We were still eating them fresh at around this point on the calendar.#$e#What? Of course I remember! They were just that good!$h
Entries.summer_9: Another day of work for me today.#$b#Hmm... I hope no one comes in with heatstroke.$s
Entries.summer_16: Eldra, one of the 'feuding brothers' constellations was at its highest point in the sky last night.#$b#Half a year from now, his brother will take his place. Our ancestors were really creative, the way they made so many detailed stories to explain the sky's phenomena.
Entries.summer_23: There's a beauty to human technology, but then there's also an even greater beauty to nature.#$b#I feel like the ultimate beauty would be a harmony between the two. What do you think?
Entries.summer_27: Just a couple more evenings until the moonlight jellies arrive. I'm really excited!#$e#To be honest, though, I'm probably nowhere near my dad's level of excitement.
Entries.fall_9: Have a good day today, honey. I'm just going to put the finishing touches on my plutonium destabilizer.#$e#Kidding.$h#$e#No, seriously, I keep the plutonium destabilizer in my secret lab. The one under the wood pile.#$e#Please tell me you didn't just fall for that!$h#$b#Er, well... oh. I guess I did have a secret lab at my old place.$s#$e#No, I didn't install a secret lab! This is your house, you goof!$h
Entries.fall_15: Yesterday was the last day to be able to plant pumpkins in time for Spirit's Eve.#$e#Actually, if you forgot, you could still do it. It'd just take a little Speed-Gro.
Entries.fall_18: Living within walking distance of my parents' house... in a house my mom remodeled...#$b#Well, I know my situation isn't exactly typical. Let me know if it ever gets weird for you, okay?#$e#You are my priority, you are my love. Now come here and kiss me.$l
Entries.fall_22: Penny lent me a book a few days ago. I think I'll get it started later today, maybe while I'm out.
Entries.winter_11: I learn best by doing things hands-on, and I try to learn something new every day.#$e#For me, knowledge is its own end. I don't have any plans to sell an invention for big money.#$b#I'm open to changing my mind on the subject if it ever becomes necessary, though.
Entries.winter_22: I love fireplaces... even more than I love central heating. Is that weird for a technophile like me?#$e#It's just that woodfire smell, and the feel of the natural heat. You can't beat it.
Entries.winter_23: I've almost finished the book that Penny lent me a while back.#$e#I don't know how she speeds through books the way she does. I only read through a few books per year.
Entries.winter_28: Happy new year, honey. Let's celebrate tonight! [232 234 223 220]$h#$b#Don't stay out too late.$l
